note.text: Pakistani food is similar to Indian food, although meat is much more widely eaten in Pakistan. Curry dishes are common, and most other dishes are heavily spiced. Yogurt is a common ingredient. If you want your food without any spice, ask for "no chilies" rather than "mild."
Bread is a staple, especially unleavened "chapati" and slightly-leavened "naan." In fact, most of the local diet consists of bread, rice, vegetables, lentils, and meat.
Hot, sweet, milky tea is probably the most common drink. Alcohol, meanwhile, is quite uncommon because Islam forbids it.
